m2mimud.game
Class Interface

java.lang.Object
  m2mimud.game.Interface
All Implemented Interfaces:
CommandExec, PlayerCommunicator
public class Interface
extends java.lang.Object
implements PlayerCommunicator, CommandExec

The interface class is responsible for controlling the interaction between the the player and the game. It obtains the user's commands and sends them off to the game, and it also provides for a way for the game to communicate messages to the user

printCombatMessage

public void printCombatMessage(java.lang.String line,
                               java.awt.Color theColor,
                               boolean player)
Prints a combat message

Specified by:
printCombatMessage in interface PlayerCommunicator
Parameters:
line - The line to print
theColor - The color to paint the text
player - A value which indicates if the player generated this text, or the player's target. If the message is generated by the player's target, the message is bolded.

setStatus

public void setStatus(boolean equi,
                      boolean balance)
Sets the status of the player. This means whether or not the the player has physical balance (from performing a physical attack) or mental equilbrium (from performing a spell).

Specified by:
setStatus in interface PlayerCommunicator
Parameters:
equi - True if the player has mental equilbrium, false otherwise
balance - True if the player has physical balance, false otherwise.
